FailureCountReward: Measures the occurrence of failures or collisions in the system. 0 indicates no failure, while 1 indicates a failure has occurred.
MeanEgoSpeedsReward: Measures the average speed of ego vehicles in the fleet. The more positive the value, the higher the average speed of the ego vehicles.
MeanHeadwaysReward: Measures the average distance between ego vehicles and their surrounding vehicles. The more positive the value, the greater the average headway distance, indicating safer distances are maintained.
SpeedExceedanceReward: Counts the number of vehicles exceeding the target velocity. 0 indicates all vehicles are within the speed limit, while higher values indicate more vehicles are exceeding the speed limit.
MeanEgoVehicleAccelerationsReward: Measures the average acceleration of ego vehicles. The more positive the value, the greater the average acceleration, indicating possibly more aggressive driving.
MeanAllVehicleSpeedsReward: Measures the average speed of all vehicles in the system. The more positive the value, the higher the average speed of all vehicles, suggesting smoother traffic flow.
SafetyHeadwayFailureReward: Balances between penalizing failures and rewarding safe headways. The more positive the value, the safer the headway distances are maintained, with fewer failures.
MinimumEgoSpeedsReward: Measures the minimum speed recorded among ego vehicles. The more positive the value, the higher the minimum speed, indicating that all ego vehicles are maintaining a reasonable speed.
MinimumHeadwaysReward: Measures the shortest headway distance maintained by ego vehicles. The more positive the value, the larger the minimum headway, indicating safer distances are maintained.
MaximumAllVehicleSpeedsReward: Measures the maximum speed achieved by any vehicle in the system. The more positive the value, the higher the maximum speed recorded, indicating potential speed limit violations.
